message.content:
cs.PL, cs.TYPES, cs.LG, cs.SE, cs.CL 

This paper deals with gradual typing, type systems, and language design, which are all topics typically found in the Programming Languages (cs.PL) sub-category. The paper specifically focuses on row types and row polymorphism, which are also relevant to the Types (cs.TYPES) sub-category. The use of scoped labels and the development of a blame calculus suggest that the paper may also be relevant to the Logic in Computer Science (cs.LG) sub-category. The discussion of type soundness and conservativity suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category. Finally, the use of casts and run-time checking suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the Computation and Language (cs.CL) sub-category.
